label: 元慶寺
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Kazanji was another name for the Gangyōji, founded in 868 by the poet-prelate Henjō (816-90) (p. 131-2n). [華山寺、遍昭] [Also read Gankeiji] [HW]
